from set timeout set timeout basically says I need you to try and execute this function every 60th per second or every
10 milliseconds and the request animation frame is much more like well I'm going to ask you to render the frame
as in I'm going to ask the browser to render kind of my next piece of logic uh my next kind of drawing command and then
let the browser decide when it should do that the interesting thing about this is that because you're asking the browser
to do the work it knows a whole lot of things that you don't know about the machine for instance like the refresh rate of the monitor so it'll try and
lock the number of times that you can call um your call back to say say 60 frames a second so if you're doing a
game um this is kind of important right so you want to lock your game to the vertical refresh rate of the actual Monitor and you can do that with the
request animation frame um the other interesting thing as well is that it's like it can act like the page visibility
